intro: Anthemis cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf tansy, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small yellow flowers that bloom in summer. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. Anthemis cuneata is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
